meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to become insane or irrational.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie really derangers me.
meanings.sent2: Loud noises can derange some people.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog derangers my thoughts.
meanings.sent4: His constant lies derange the truth in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house deranges my sense of reality.

meanings.definition: Disturb the normal operation or function of (something).
meanings.sent1: The storm derangers the power lines.
meanings.sent2: A sudden change in plans can derange the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat deranges the neatly arranged books.
meanings.sent4: The virus deranges the computer system.
meanings.sent5: The broken gear deranges the entire machine.
